entry.name: MAV_CMD_AEROB_DO_CHANDELLE
entry.description: Mission command to perform an aircraft control maneuver where the pilot combines a 180 degrees turn with a climb

entry.name: MAV_CMD_AEROB_SEARCH
entry.description: Issue a command "Search a target" to the payload

entry.name: MAV_CMD_AEROB_STEERING
entry.description: Issue a command "Steering" to the payload

entry.name: MAV_CMD_AEROB_PAYLOAD_SHOOTDONW
entry.description: Issue a command "Shootdown" to the payload

entry.name: MAV_CMD_AEROB_ZONE_EXIT
entry.description: Exit point zone of interest. Parameters same as in MAV_CMD_NAV_WAYPOINT
entry.param: Hold time in decimal seconds. (ignored by fixed wing, time to stay at MISSION for rotary wing)
Acceptance radius in meters (if the sphere with this radius is hit, the MISSION counts as reached)
0 to pass through the WP, if > 0 radius in meters to pass by WP. Positive value for clockwise orbit, negative value for counter-clockwise orbit. Allows trajectory control.
Desired yaw angle at MISSION (rotary wing)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_AEROB_SET_ANTENNA_TRACKER_PID
entry.param: Motor soft start [% per second], -1: ignore

entry.name: MAV_CMD_AEROB_PAYLOAD_POWER_ON
entry.description: Issue a command "Power On" to the payload

entry.name: MAV_CMD_AEROB_FLIGHT_ZONE
entry.description: Set points is determined by flight zone
entry.param: Zone Category. Flight zone, Restricted area, Dangerous area...

entry.name: MAV_CMD_AEROB_GENERATOR_ON
entry.description: Issue a command "Power On" to the payload

entry.name: MAV_CMD_AEROB_AUX_PWR_ON
entry.description: Issue a command "Power On" to the auxiliary power supply

entry.name: MAV_CMD_AEROB_PARACHUTE_RELEASE
entry.description: Issue a command to release a parachute

entry.name: MAV_CMD_AEROB_RESET_WIND
entry.description: Issue a command to reset wind data

entry.name: MAV_CMD_AEROB_AIRBAG
entry.description: Issue a command to open airbag

entry.name: MAV_CMD_AEROB_PARACHUTE_DEPLOY
entry.description: Point of precision landing parachute deploy

entry.name: SYSTEM_STATE_CALIBRATING
entry.description: System is calibrating and not flight-ready.

entry.name: SYSTEM_STATE_STANDBY
entry.description: System is grounded and on standby. It can be launched any time.

entry.name: SYSTEM_STATE_ACTIVE
entry.description: System is active and might be already airborne. Motors are engaged.

entry.name: SYSTEM_STATE_FLIGHT_GUIDED_ROLL
entry.description: System flight in guided roll mode

entry.name: SYSTEM_STATE_FLIGHT_GUIDED_POSHOLD
entry.description: System flight in guided future mode 1

entry.name: SYSTEM_STATE_FLIGHT_GUIDED_FUTURE2
entry.description: System flight in guided future mode 2

entry.name: SYSTEM_STATE_FLIGHT_GUIDED_FUTURE3
entry.description: System flight in guided future mode 3

entry.name: SYSTEM_STATE_FLIGHT_GUIDED_FUTURE4
entry.description: System flight in guided future mode 4

entry.name: SYSTEM_STATE_FLIGHT_GUIDED_FUTURE5
entry.description: System flight in guided future mode 5

entry.name: SYSTEM_STATE_FLIGHT_GUIDED_FUTURE6
entry.description: System flight in guided future mode 6

entry.name: SYSTEM_STATE_FLIGHT_GUIDED_FUTURE7
entry.description: System flight in guided future mode 7

entry.name: SYSTEM_STATE_FLIGHT_GUIDED_FUTURE8
entry.description: System flight in guided future mode 8

entry.name: SYSTEM_STATE_FLIGHT_GUIDED_FUTURE9
entry.description: System flight in guided future mode 9

entry.name: SYSTEM_STATE_FLIGHT_GUIDED_FUTURE10
entry.description: System flight in guided future mode 10

entry.name: SYSTEM_STATE_CRITICAL
entry.description: System is in a non-normal flight mode. It can however still navigate.

entry.name: SYSTEM_STATE_EMERGENCY
entry.description: System is in a non-normal flight mode. It lost control over parts or over the whole airframe. It is in mayday and going down.

entry.name: SYSTEM_STATE_POWEROFF
entry.description: System just initialized its power-down sequence, will shut down now.

enum.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG
enum.description: These flags encode the MAV mode.

entry.name: SHORT_MESSAGE_NAV_IRU
entry.description: Latitude, Longitude, TrackAngle from inertial reference unit

message.name: AEROB_SLOW_SENSOR
message.field: Current throttle setting in integer percent, 0 to 100

message.name: AEROB_VERY_SLOW_SENSOR
message.description: Aerob sensor telemetry packet (very low speed)

message.name: AEROB_HEARTBEAT
message.field: System RTC time in millisecond since Unix epoch
Packets received at last second by channel RF1
Packets sent at last second by channel RF1
Packets received at last second by channel RF2
Packets sent at last second by channel RF2

message.name: AEROB_STABILIZE_DESIRED
message.field: Stabilize flags bitmask. ROLL = 1, PITCH = 2, YAW = 4, COURSE = 8, ALTITUDE = 16, VSPEED 32, SPEED = 64, LEVEL = 128
Desired vertical speed, meters per seconds
Desired horizontal speed, meters per seconds
Desired Roll Rate, degrees per seconds
Desired Pitch Rate, degrees per seconds
Desired Yaw Rate, degrees per seconds

message.name: AEROB_RC_CHANNELS
message.description: The PPM values of the RC channels received. The standard PPM modulation is as follows: 1000 microseconds: 0%, 2000 microseconds: 100%. Individual receivers/transmitters might violate this specification.
message.field: RC channel 1 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 2 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 3 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 4 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 5 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 6 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 7 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 8 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 9 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 10 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 11 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 12 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 13 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 14 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 15 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 16 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 17 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 18 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.

message.name: AEROB_SERVO_OUTPUT
message.description: The RAW values of the servo outputs. The standard PPM modulation is as follows: 1000 microseconds: 0%, 2000 microseconds: 100%.

message.name: AEROB_COMMAND
message.description: Send a command with up to seven parameters to the MAV
message.field: System which should execute the command
Component which should execute the command, 0 for all components
Command ID, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 1, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 2, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 3, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 4, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 5, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 6, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 7, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.

message.name: AEROB_COMMAND_ACK
message.description: Report status of a command. Includes feedback wether the command was executed.
message.field: Command ID, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.

message.name: AEROB_STABILIZE_DESIRED2
message.field: Stabilize flags bitmask. ROLL = 1, PITCH = 2, YAW = 4, COURSE = 8, ALTITUDE = 16, VSPEED 32, SPEED = 64, POS = 128, GOV = 256, LALT = 512
Critical flags bitmask. ROLL = 1, PITCH = 2, YAW = 4, COURSE = 8, ALTITUDE = 16, VSPEED 32, SPEED = 64, POS = 128, GOV = 256, LALT = 512
Desired vertical speed, meters per seconds
Desired horizontal speed, meters per seconds
Desired Roll Rate, degrees per seconds
Desired Pitch Rate, degrees per seconds
Desired Yaw Rate, degrees per seconds

message.name: AEROB_VIDEO_HANDSHAKE
message.field: type of requested/acknowledged data (as defined in ENUM DATA_TYPES in mavlink/include/mavlink_types.h)
total data size in bytes (set on ACK only)
Width of a matrix or image
Height of a matrix or image
number of packets beeing sent (set on ACK only)
payload size per packet (normally 245 byte, see DATA field size in message AEROB_VIDEO_DATA) (set on ACK only)

message.name: AEROB_VIDEO_DATA
message.field: sequence number (starting with 0 on every transmission)

message.name: AEROB_AUX_SENSOR
message.description: Aerob auxiliary sensor packet (max 10 Hz rate)

message.name: AEROB_STABILIZE_DESIRED1
message.field: Stabilize flags bitmask. ROLL = 1, PITCH = 2, YAW = 4, COURSE = 8, ALTITUDE = 16, VSPEED 32, SPEED = 64, LEVEL = 128
Critical flags bitmask. ROLL = 1, PITCH = 2, YAW = 4, COURSE = 8, ALTITUDE = 16, VSPEED 32, SPEED = 64, LEVEL = 128
Desired vertical speed, meters per seconds
Desired horizontal speed, meters per seconds
Desired Roll Rate, degrees per seconds
Desired Pitch Rate, degrees per seconds
Desired Yaw Rate, degrees per seconds

message.name: AEROB_SHORT_MESSAGE
message.description: Aerob telemetry short message. To send over slow channels and satellite modem (payload = 64 byte)
message.field: Course over ground (GPS) in degrees * 100, 0.0..359.99 degrees

message.name: AEROB_GCS_ENVIRONMENT
message.field: GCS time in millisecond since Unix epoch
Wind speed near GCS in m/s
Wind direction near GCS in degrees
Packets received at last second by this channel
Packets sent at last second by this channel

message.name: AEROB_SPECIAL_UAV1
message.field: Consumed charge, in milliampere hours (1 = 1 mAh), -1: autopilot does not provide mAh consumption estimate
Battery current, in 10*milliamperes (1 = 10 milliampere), -1: autopilot does not measure the current
Battery voltage of cells, in millivolts (1 = 1 millivolt). Cells above the valid cell count for this battery should have the UINT16_MAX value.
Course over ground (GPS) in degrees * 100, 0.0..359.99 degrees
Roll angular rate, degrees per sec * 1E2
Pitch angular rate, degrees per sec * 1E2
Number of satellites visible. If unknown, set to 255

message.name: AEROB_FAST_SENSOR2
message.field: Angular speed around X axis (-20000..20000 millirad/sec)
Angular speed around Y axis (-20000..20000 millirad/sec)
Angular speed around Z axis (-20000..20000 millirad/sec)
